intro: Ptilotus rotundatus, commonly known as the "bush morning glory," is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces small, spherical fruits that contain seeds. Ptilotus rotundatus is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional Indigenous Australian practices.
